detailsOfAchievement: Dr. K.R. Adhikary College of Optometry and Paramedical Technology started its journey at Kalyani, Nadia, West Bengal under the active guidance of Greater Kolkata Doctors Association on 28th September 2003 with an affiliation from University of Kalyani. Different Optometry and Paramedical courses of Kalyani University are conducted by us.Dr. K.R. Adhikary College is a voluntary organization and regularly arrange and actively take part in the social activities that are related to the solution of health hazards of common people mainly in rural and slum areas and we feel proud and honoured to take part in this type of health related activities which are beneficial for the society around us and the mankind as a whole. Our institution never tries and desire to get monetary benefit from these activities.In the year 2003 we also started an Out Patients Department named Dr. K.R. Adhikary Seva Pratisthan at 3 Bijoynagar Coloney, East Kanthalpara, Madral Road, Naihati, North 24 Parganas, West Bengal. General Physician and Specialist Doctors are regularly examining the patients and distribute free medicines as per our capability from 2 P.M. onwards in all working days except Sunday and holidays. From the year 2006 we started Cataract Operation with I.O.L. implantation at free of cost among poor populatin about 30 numbers of patients per month in collaboration with Rotary Hooghly Eye Hospital. Under National programme for control of Blindness, our desire to establish an Eye operation theater and also for interest of the locality like to established maternity unit in this Seva Pratisthan. From 2nd July 2009 at 6th anniversary of our Seva Pratisthan we started different investigation services at minimal rate in collaboration with MIC, Adhikary X-ray Clinic.At present the address of our College is B-13/66, Kalyani, Nadia which is a two storied rented building. On 11th February 2009 we started an Out Patients Department in this building with all facilities like Dr. K.R. Adhikary Seva Pratisthan, Naihati. Prof. Dr. Arabinda Kumar Das, Vice Chancellor, University of Kalyani kindly inaugurated this O.P.D. and Dr. Tapash Kumar Banerjee, Joint Director of Health Services (Administration), Govt. of West Bengal occupied the chair of Chief Guest at inaugural session.We arrange different seminar to upgrade and refresh knowledge among the Health Professionals and to educate women on legal matters and rights of women in the society. We also arrange different awareness programme in rural and slum areas.We like to work among the mentally and physically disable population and we hope our mission will be fulfilled.Our desire to establish a General Hospital in which super speciality services will be provided at a minimal cost among the poor and middle class people.At present our working areas are as follows :NADIA : Kalyani, Majherchar, Kalitala, Madanpur, Shimurali, Chakdaha, Gangnapur, Gayeshpur.NORTH 24 PARGANAS : 3 No. Bijoynagar Coloney, Naihati, Gorifa, Rajbandigarh, Gouripur, Hazinagar, Halisahar, Bhatpara, Keutia, Madral, Rathtala, Kankinara, Jagatdal, Gurdaha Coloney, Shyamnagar, Garulia, Palta.HOWRAH (In collaboration with Bijoy Krishna Girls College) : Bankra Panchayet I and II and Bijoy Krishna Girls College.

title: DRAMMAR
detailsOfAchievement: DRAMMAR is now almost 5 years old. During this rather short tenure it has been able to create an impression in the theatre lovers community of Kolkata. So far, we have created four full length productions for regular proscenium shows and two short duration plays appropriate for fairs, festivals and street shows. Two of our productions are from renowned authors and two are completely written by Sukumar Chakraborty, our secretary and director as well. Although we could not arrange large number of shows, mostly due to our financial limitations, but the limited number of shows we arranged for each and every one of our productions, had been accepted very well, also appreciated and applauded by our audience. We got positive feedbacks from the critics also, and got good reviews in local news papers. We have got call shows from different organizations in and around Kolkata, which again proves the acceptability of our productions. We have worked on several different subjects ranging from human relationships (PUTUL NACHER ITIKATHA by Manik Bandopadhyay) to exploitation of women by male dominant society (BOHIPEER by Syed Waliullah); Political musical satire in the context of mythology (KALKIPURAN by Sukumar Chakraborty) to a comedy attacking the corruption and ill-practices in the Medical Industry (HECHKI by Sukumar Chakraborty). Apart from holding shows, we have also organized several workshops to spread theatre literacy among the people, especially among the youth, and to train them. We have sought help from some renowned theatre personalities to take a couple of classes. As a result of this, couple of members groomed by DRAMMAR are working in other media also like Television, Cinema, etc.

detailsOfAchievement: Out of the above objectives only primary education, Basic computer education,Nutrition program & a small development and repair works of Sishu Bharati Vidyalaya ( primary) were taken into consideration since registration of our society( NGO). Our NGO( Dum Dum DR B R Ambedkar Smriti Samity) was registered on 17.04.12 and our organization arranged to provide fiscal facilities of 26 students (Boys & Girls) and 17 students (Boys & Girls) in the 1st. & 2nd. financial year of Dr Baba Saheb Bbim Rao Ambedkar School in the classes in pre-Nursery, Lower Nursery, upper Nursery and classes -I, II, III, IV at Ramkrishnanagar, Manikpur, Kol-79 and all the expenses as regards admission and tuition fees of 43 students totaling Rs. 27,540.00 ( Rs. 16,760.00 + Rs. 10,780.00 ) were born by our NGO for fiscal year 2012-13 and 2013-14 abd ab arrangement of 102 students belonged to B P L & Poverty-stricken families in different classes in different school were taken into consideration for fiscal year 2014-15 , but failed due to scarcity of fund and we were forced to divert our program to repair a school house with the cost of Rs. 5782.00 for the financial year 2014-15 to save the school from ruin as well as to save the life of the poor kids of Sishu Bharati Vidyalaya(primary) which was in a very dangerous position to collapse at any time causing life in danger of the poor kids of the school. Besides, Basic computer classes ( free of cost ) were started at our office premises and 40 students of Sishu Bharati Vidyalaya attended in computer classes in the day from 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. in a batch of 6/7 students class-wise daily (except holidays) as per school routine for the fiscal 2014-15. Nutrition program was considered with a view to take care of the pregnant Mothers of the BPL & Poverty-stricken families in the society as the 50% of the baby born in India with malnutrition due to malnutrition of the pregnant Mothers. Our NGO arranged to provide Nutritious food , drinks and vitamin tablets to the pregnant mothers (5) @ Rs.200.00 per pregnant mother totaling Ra.1000.00 for the fiscal year 2014-15. In the fiscal year2015-16 , our Society has considered to execute a repair works of the old primary School house, Sishu Bharati Vidyalaya at Manikpur Milonpark,Kol-79 with a cost of Rs.5782.00 for the fiscal year2015-16. These were a very small works and does not attract any attention as the works of a NGO and it was due to scarcity of fund. If your kindness allow us to have the UNEQUE ID along with a chance to get the fund from the Govt. of India , we would try to serve the poorer section of people in the society in the days to come. detailsOfAchievement: Friends of Tribals Society (FTS) was established in 1989 at Kolkata by some eminent philanthropists with the object of all-round development of tribals in our country. Following Swami Vivekanands dictum Where the child cannot come to the school, the school must go to the child the founding members of FTS started the concept of One Teacher Schools (Ekal Vidyalalya) wherein a teacher, usually an educated young person from the village, teaches about 25-30 children of class 1, 2 and 3. These informal schools are conducted for three hours every day and apart from elementary education the children are also imparted basic health training including yoga and exercise and knowledge of Indian culture and heritage and handicrafts etc. Training of these teachers is also done once every month and for five days every six months. As on September 30, 2016 FTS along with its associate organizations were running 52453 schools in the remote villages across the country and FTS alone was running 29463 schools. Monitoring of running of these schools is done by an intricate system of administration at state, district and sub district level and the data on running and working of the schools in centrally collected at the societys head office and analysed every month. With time and in keeping with the changing needs of the times, FTS has also expanded the scope of its work in the villages. Under Awareness Education, they discuss various issues for benefit of the village like eradication of alcoholism, settlement of their mutual issues and the government schemes for the benefit of the villagers.This programme creates a very healthy atmosphere in the village. Whenever necessary, FTS sewabratis help them in filing application under Right to Information Act. (RTI). Moreover the scope of education was expanded not only to include health and hygiene but also development education. Under development education the villagers are encouraged to produce fertilizer from cow dung and Pesticides from cow urine. The children of FTS schools are encouraged to plant at least one sapling each year. These are normally planted in and around the houses of the villagers so that they can take care of the sapling and also become owner of the trees. This also develops a creative attitude among children. Impact of FTS work: Due to the various activities run by FTS in the villages there is improvement in the state of education both for the children and the guardians. The villagers are gradually leading a more hygienic life, their financial condition is improving on account of various development activities. They are also getting rid of addiction to alcohol and the most important aspect is that with inculcation of moral values they also develop dedication to Mother Bharat.

detailsOfAchievement: Established in 1998, Karini - Mukesh Himatsingka Group has grown to its current position as one of the largest Automobile Dealership Group in Eastern India. The group has strength of 1300 employees with a turnover of close to 600 crores per annum. It has a diversified business portfolio comprising of Automobile Dealerships,Spare Part Distributorships, Fast food restaurants, Education & Skill Development. The group has been a torch bearer in the Auto sector during past 18 years. The group ventured into imparting education and skill develsopment since 2008 under the brand name of Mukesh Training Academy (MTA). MTA is envisioned as an integrated technical, IT and Vocational Training and Development Institute addressing the entire spectrum of employability needs in India in the technical sphere. We also provide vocational training courses for BTech and Diploma Engineering students in the field of Mechanical, Electrical and Electronics. Placement linked skill training programme sponsored by the Central Government and the State Governments are also a key area for the group. We impart training in different states of India like West Bengal, Jharkhand, Assam, Orissa, Arunachal Pradesh, Tripura and other North East States. We have been empanelled by different Government Bodies like MANAS, NDLM, PBSSD, West Bengal NULM, Jharkhand NULM, North Eastern Council, WBSCSTD & FC, WBTDCC, State Welfare Jharkhand and Department of Skill Development & Employment Generation, Itanagar. We are also a partner of ASDC (Automotive Skill Development Council)

detailsOfAchievement: Promoted 10,000 People Action Groups and Women Action Groups in 7 states of India, ( West Bengal, Bihar, Orissa, Assam, Tripura, Manipur, Jharkhand. Strengthened 5,000 Small Action Groups in seven states of India- West Bengal, Behar, Orissa, Assam, Tripura, Jharkhand and Manipur.Trained 500 youths of West Bengal & Sikim State in Rural Entrepreneurship development programme with the support of KVIC, NABARD, SIDBI and EDI Amadabad. Running AHVY ( Baba Ambedkar Hastashilp Vikash Yogana) under the Ministry of Textiles ( Development Commissioner, Handicrafts), Govt. of India at South Dinajpur District for skill upgradation Prog for 600 Rural Women. Trained 10000 Health workers for RCH and ASHA, STD/ HIV/ AIDS Prog of Govt. of Indias Health Scheme and NACO Programme in West Bengal. Promoted 4,000 SHG ( Self Help Groups) in West Bengal, Orissa, Assam. Running Innovative Project for 350 Street Food Vendors in Kolkata sponsored by INNOAID, Denmark Imparted Vocational Training to more than 5,000 people (Male & Female) in West Bengal and Jharkhand on different items like Jute ( NCJD), Cutting, Weaving Embroidery, T.V., Tape Recorder Repairing, Fabric, Knitting, Printing, Mora making , Poultry, Carpentry, Type writing, Alta, Phenol , Insence stick ( KVIC) Mushroom production/ Orissa, card making etc. More than Rural Artisans ( 15,000) got marketing support from us and marketed their products through shop, Mela ( CAPART sponsored). Covering a large number of CSW/ Truckers/ Helpers through Youth generation, Mother & Child awareness generation programmes on burning issues like STD/ HIV/ AIDS, Pulse Polio, Child Marriage, Child Labour prohibition, Human Rights etc in 7 states of West Bengal supported by NACO/ UNICEF, Dept of Social Welfare. Providing Short term support on rehabilitation towards 30 inmates in a batch through a Short Stay Home since 1998 to till date with the support of Central Social Welfare Board. Providing all round development support to 500 Street Children including ( in a batch) Child Labour and slum dwellers since 1993 with the support of Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt. of India. Presently Running Open Shelter for Boys(25) under Integrated Child Protection Scheme ( ICPS). Promoted a National level Network to protect Human Rights of Women called Nari Adhikar Raksha Samannaya Samity. Established a 6 beded Mother and child care unit in West Bengal with all pathological, X-Ray, Ambulance facility. Established an Ashram in the name of Mahatma Gandhi in Jharkhand for undertaking demonstrative project and all round development project of the village poor people. Established a Training cum-one night shelter in Kolkata for the destitute women. Published lot of Books, Journals/ Pamphlet, Flipcharts, Leaflet on socio-economic, Health and legal issues. Made Cassettes on gender/ STD/ HIV/ AIDS issue. Trained 25,000 people on Community Based Disaster Preparedness supported by UNICEF. 1 Lakh Number of trees planted through our Social Forestry Programme. Providing relevant counseling ( on line) to destitute Women through 24 hour on line services supported by Ministry of Women & Children Dept. Conducting issue based Need Assessment/ Baseline Survey/ Mid-line assessment/ Fact finding on witch crafts/ violence against women & children in 3 states of India.
